sense.name: a committee or delegation of people
sense.examples: They'll have to bring up this issue before the zoning commission. The president has appointed a blue ribbon commission to look into this matter. The city may form a commission to explore ways to reduce traffic congestion in the downtown district.

sense.name: a service fee
sense.examples: The brokers make a 2 percent commission on each trade. These salesmen earn have their annual income in commissions. John is selling the house himself to avoid paying commissions to real estate agents. She is working on commission at the shoe store.

sense.name: the act of authorization
sense.examples: The new aircraft carrier is now in commission. (authorized to be an operational ship) The jurors have received a commission from the judge to disregard the witness's testimony. Our architectural firm has received the commission to build the new bridge.

sense.name: the state of being in working order
sense.examples: The air conditioner is out of commission again! John's mechanic got his car back into commission.

sense.name: an official document conferring rank to someone
sense.examples: Bob received his commission upon graduating from the military academy. His naval commission was signed by the admiral of the U.S. Navy.

sense.name: the act of perpetrating a crime
sense.commentary: COMMISSION[+action][+perpetration][+crime] Note: this is a true nominalization of the verb form 'commit'
sense.examples: The commission of treason in a time of war is punishable by execution. His commission of multiple counts of insider trading got him five years in prison.
